ratings.comment: Dr. Choi is very passionate about chemistry and gives great lectures. There is a textbook for the class, but exams are written based almost entirely off of homework and lecture slides. There is a large project lab for the class, which is poorly designed and incredibly confusing. People say it is an easy grade, but I found it was graded harshly.

Took the joint class with buchberger and Choi. Choi's lectures were great and she gave quick feedback on any questions over email. Her tests were easy so long as you understood the homework. Project lab sucked, having a grade dependent on idiots is never good. However, the group projects are a marginal part of the grade so just do well on exams.

She is one of the most amazing lecturers I have had, and I would highly recommend taking any class taught by her as she makes everything crystal clear in terms of expectations. On top of that, she is hilarious! She puts a lot of work into teaching and expects her students to reciprocate that, which makes for a fantastic professor.

Her lectures and lecture notes are reasonably clear. She follows the textbook almost word for word, so the best way to get a good grade is to read the book and do practice problems at the end of chapters. Weekly homework assignments are end of chapter problems for a completion grade, solutions available in the book, the solutions manual or on chegg

She teaches the material very well and the tests are simple and straightforward. Her rating does not reflect how easy the class was compared to other Chem 104 professors. All you need to do is study the tophat questions and lecture slides and you'll do well.

Some people like her, but I haven't heard that from any people in my lecture. She's intense and unrelenting in lecture and calls students out. Her tests are difficult, and she is vindictive in enforcing her policies, such as no notecards on the tests. She explains the material in an impatient, apathetic way, and is angry if you don't get it. Rough.

Professor Choi is an excellent Chem 104 professor. Her exams are straight forward and many exam questions come from TopHat questions. She does not allow note cards on exams, but her exams are written so that you do not need one. Choi is very underrated & those who say she isn't a good professor are just looking for excuses for their lack of effort.

Ripping into one kid for sending an email that she disagreed with in front of 300 people  thoroughly annoyed me and was unprofessional. While good at lecturing and giving the most fair chemistry exams Ive encountered, she demands too much attention and if someone whistles, she will stop class for minutes and try to call the student out. Chill.

Professor Choi is a very nice and not very intimidating however my praise for her ends there. She is one of the worst professors I've had. Her lectures are very unclear, partly due because of her accent but she also does not specify what she would like you to learn for the exam and what she covers in lecture is not enough. If you can try to avoid!

Professor Choi was a great professor for chem. Her lectures were clear and she does her best to keep students engaged with jokes and extra credit clicker questions. Her exams are fair, but be prepared for a tough final exam! I would definitely take this class with her again.

Lectures can be very boring, but she covers everything you need to know on tests in her lectures and will randomly throw extra credit questions at you. Tests are hard, but very fair. No trick questions or surprises. If you make sure you complete labs and the weekly homework, class is a guaranteed B.

I was skeptical of her after reading some of her earlier reviews, but she ended up being one of my favorite professors this semester. Professor Choi is also hilarious. She does not curve the class, but gives some extra credit clicker questions sometimes in lecture. Tests are straight forward. She grades tough, but fair. Weekly online homework.

The class is by no means easy. Skipping class is a big no-no since no notecards are allowed on the tests so it is best to take notes. However, her questions are clear cut and she abides by her promise of straight forward tests. Do the homework and study the lecture notes before the exams and you'll do fine. She also gives extra credit sometimes.
Choi is a good professor, but be prepared for tricky tests. You have to study a ton for a good grade despite what you may initially think.

Choi is a fair and consistent grader, but her lectures don't always make a whole lot of sense. She's not super engaging and I find her  a little harder to way attention to.  You've got to do lots of practice problems for the exams and memorize everything (she doesn't allow note cards). She doesn't curve unless it's really necessary.
Great Chem 104 professor, or the greatest chem 104 professor? Easy A
Expect tricky exams. Overall, a good professor that knows her stuff. When she repeats herself with "what did i say," it's generally something important that will end up on an exam.
least effective among all chem teachers; expect too much out of students compared little chemistry she taught to them

Extremely hard tests.  I would spend days studying and then still do poorly. The exams only had 16 or so multiple choice, but they were each 5 points. She goes through lecture slides quickly and it isn't possible to get all the notes down, and she's hard to understand sometimes do to her accent. Overall, this class was harder than it needed to be.

Her lectures are normally very disorganized, and she does not seem interested in teaching. She cant usually answer questions very well in class. I would definitely not want to take her in a chemistry class again and wouldn't recommend her.

Way too hard for an intro class. 25 question MC exams that were impossible. She told our lecture we were either stupid or lazy because the average was 45100 on the first exam. I was in the hospital during one exam and she failed me on it. I do not recommend her.
Teacher was very tough, and made you understand everything very conceptually. I have never studied so hard for a class. She knows her stuff and teaches well though.

This was her first year so I'd cut her some slack, but she expected WAY too much from an intro course. Tests were impossible no matter how hard you studied. Very nice lady and interesting lectures. Practice questions & homework too easy then tests beyond hard. No curve. Promised extra credit but cancelled that within last two weeks of class
